summary: This document is an email chain from June 2019 between U.S. Marshals and Diplomatic Security Service personnel regarding confirmation from Austrian authorities that Jeffrey Epstein's private plane (tail number N212JE), with Epstein and three female passengers, landed in Vienna, Austria on March 22, 2019. The group visited Café Landmann before departing for Paris later that same evening.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Identified as the individual on the private plane (N212JE) that landed in Vienna, Austria on March 22, 2019, with three female passengers.

persons.name: Poldi
persons.context: Mentioned as the source of the flight and passenger information for Epstein's plane provided by Austrian police.

connections.description: Poldi, an Austrian police contact, provided flight confirmation and passenger details about Epstein's travel to U.S. law enforcement.

events.title: Epstein's travel to Vienna, Austria
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein's private plane (tail number N212JE) landed at Vienna Airport at 5:00 PM with Epstein and three female passengers. The group visited Café Landmann in Vienna before departing for Paris at 10:00 PM the same day.

events.title: Austrian police provide flight confirmation
events.description: An Austrian police contact ('Poldi') provides detailed information about Epstein's flight and activities in Vienna to U.S. authorities.

events.title: U.S. law enforcement email correspondence
events.description: U.S. Marshals and Diplomatic Security Service personnel exchange emails confirming Epstein's travel to Austria and discussing next steps.

keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein traveled to Vienna, Austria on March 22, 2019, via private plane (tail number N212JE).
Epstein was accompanied by three unidentified female passengers during this trip.
The group visited Café Landmann in Vienna before flying to Paris later the same night.
The travel confirmation was provided by Austrian police to U.S. Marshals and Diplomatic Security Service in June 2019.
The document shows active U.S. law enforcement interest in tracking Epstein's international movements in 2019.
